column4: anyone have a quick recommendation for re-sizing my ubuntu partition?  GUI would be nice.  Want to play with another OS.
you are going to have to do it in live cd though if it is your root partition

I would imagine it uses iwconfig to determine the ssid, then iwconfig to configure the card and then dhclient to acquire an ip, that is how I would do it at least. I know that is how wifi-radar does it, I have never used nm-applet though
the first one should say iwlist to determine the ssid
i figured something like that.  But my problem is whats running in the background and auto-connecting so that i can stop it. :P
I don't know, see ps -A and see if any of the names look right, it may be nm-applet, I think that is what ubuntu goes with
good idea.  there is "NetworkManager" , "NetworkManagerD", and "nm-applet" the last probably just being the GUI front-end
the second one would be the daemon and the first one is likely the actual thing located at /usr/sbin/networkmanager, you could probably kill the first two
i like that idea.  if it breaks i will just re-start them
for the record they both have man pages, NetworkManager and NetworkManagerDispatcher
ya i used wifi-radar for a bit, but i guess im getting used to networkmanager

I like that you can launch it with sudo therefore meaning no password, I know networkmanager requires keyring, and that it is standalone so I can shortcut with keyboard seeing as its only use is on a laptop and all
dont think i ever used the shortcut
